title: How to Make Mango Ice Cream

steps.headline: Wash and peel the skin from the mangoes.
Add the mango pieces to the blender.
Pour the blended mango (puree)in a bowl.
steps.description:
Add the whipped cream. Beat the mixture at a low speed for 2 minutes. Then add the one tablespoon of condensed milk. steps.headline: Transfer the paste to a freezer-safe bowl.
See if the ice cream has set after 6 hours.
steps.description: When it's set properly, scoop the ice cream in a sundae glass and garnish with some mint.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy.
steps.description: Fresh mint or berries make delicious compatible garnishes.

text:
Wash and peel the skin from the mangoes. Cut them into cubes. Add the mango pieces to the blender. Pour the blended mango (puree)in a bowl. Add the whipped cream. Beat the mixture at a low speed for 2 minutes. Then add the one tablespoon of condensed milk. Mix well using a spoon/spatula until it is like a smooth paste. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c6\/Make-Mango-Ice-Cream-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Mango-Ice-Cream-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/c\/c6\/Make-Mango-Ice-Cream-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/aid3065147-v4-728px-Make-Mango-Ice-Cream-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Transfer the paste to a freezer-safe bowl. Freeze the mixture for 6 hours. See if the ice cream has set after 6 hours. When it's set properly, scoop the ice cream in a sundae glass and garnish with some mint. Serve and enjoy. Fresh mint or berries make delicious compatible garnishes.
